head.title: 2 Killed in Attacks in Brooklyn and on S.I.

hedline.hl1: 2 Killed in Attacks in Brooklyn and on S.I.
hedline.hl2: 2 Killed in Attacks in Brooklyn and on S.I.

block.p: A Brooklyn man died Friday night after he was stabbed in the neck, and on Staten Island a man standing in front of a deli was killed early yesterday after he was shot by a man in a moving car, the police said.
No one was arrested yesterday afternoon in either killing, and the motives had not been determined, the police said.

A Brooklyn man died Friday night after he was stabbed in the neck, and on Staten Island a man standing in front of a deli was killed early yesterday after he was shot by a man in a moving car, the police said.

A Brooklyn man died Friday night after he was stabbed in the neck, and on Staten Island a man standing in front of a deli was killed early yesterday after he was shot by a man in a moving car, the police said.
No one was arrested yesterday afternoon in either killing, and the motives had not been determined, the police said.

They said that around 10 p.m. on Friday, Francisco Quiles, 27, was found on Rugby Road in Ditmas Park, Brooklyn, bleeding heavily from a single stab wound to his neck. He was pronounced dead at Kings County Hospital Center.
The police said that a light-colored two-door hatchback with a rear spoiler was seen driving from the scene and that the victim's car was found nearby.

On Staten Island around 3:30 a.m. yesterday, a man in a moving car fired four shots at John Chase, 26, of Warren Street, as he stood in front of a deli at 202 Gordon Street, across the street from the Stapleton Houses project, the police said.
Mr. Chase was hit once in his right eye. The car carrying the gunman drove away.
The police said Mr. Chase was taken to St. Vincent's Hospital Staten Island, where he was pronounced dead soon after the attack.
